comment: pitched saturday around 3pm at 60ish, by monday its at high krausen, outside temp is 64
1.5 qts per lb, for 9.375 gallons mash water.  12 gallons of sparge water to be safe, need to pull 13 to finish around 11, for 2 5.5 gallon batches into fermentor.
using amarillo instead of cascade in the dry hop, cascade was the original.
ended up with near 12 gallons of 1055, but worked out well due to all the hops, final addition was 2 simcoe 2 cascade (not 1 cent).
151 mash in, 149 at the end, didnt mash out, probs lowered efficiency
used 3 amarillo and 2 simcoe in each 5 gal batch for dry hop
dry hoped for 4 days at room temp (61), cold crashed at 35 after that

transferred to kegs, 1012 finishing gravity (when corrected for temp) from 1055, 5.64% abv, OG, FG and abv on the low end, mashed normal.  used a decent amount of crystal though so being on the dry end and lower end of OG and FG, should be delish! smelled fruity and a bit dank, should be a good mix.
